page.title: 20OPEN SPACES
page.content: {Prince's{ Green,}which lies between Egypt Point Lighthouse and the Grantham Hotel was presented to the town in the 19th Century by the Stephenson family of railway fame. Thomas George Stephenson owned and lived for a time in the large Victorian Villa, which is now the Grantham Hotel, although it was built for a member of the Peerage. A plaque on the wall by the steps commemorates the gift, which was celebrated by a special town holiday and tea_party for the children. In East Cowes the{Shedden Esplanade was built in 1920 to ease unemployment and land was given by Q.Shedden and S.E. Saunders. Today the gardens with their seats, beach huts,paddling pool,roundabout and slide,add to the receational diversity of the esplanade.
